name: influential
content:

C1 having a lot of influence on someone or something: She wanted to work for a bigger and more influential (= powerful) newspaper.influential in Johnson was influential (= important) in persuading the producers to put money into the film.
More examplesFewer examplesHe has his own ways of beating the system, making sure that he has good relationships with influential people.He sat under the most influential teacher in his field.He was very influential in shaping the government's economic policy/strategy.Two influential senators have argued for the retention of the unpopular tax.He is regarded as one of the most influential film directors of his generation.
